htxA9Cr1.title: Studies on anti-aging activity of Ginkgo Albumin Protein (GAP)
htxA9Cr1.abstract: Aim: By using natural aging mice and D-galactose-induced subacute aging mice, Anti-aging effects of GAP were studied and the mechanism of the effects was discussed. Methods: In the experiments of D-galactose-induced subacute aging mice, effect of GAP on viscera was determined by measuring body weight and organ weight. MTT method was employed to investigate T lymphocyte and B lymphocyte proliferation, thymocytes proliferation was employed to investigate activity of IL-2, SOD activity GSH-Px activity and MDA content in serum were determined using chemicalbiological methods, effect of GAP on hemogram in mice was analyzed by instrument analysis; In the experiments of natural aging mice, effect on immune organ, carbon granula clearance ability, serum hemolysin level, DTH induced by DNFB were determined. Results: In the experiments of D-galactose-induced subacute aging mice, GAP showed good effects such as increasing thymus index and spleen index of model mice, promoting proliferation of activated and inactivated T, B lymphocyte in vitro, stimulating IL-2 secretion of lymphocyte, enhancing leucocyte number and antioxidative capacity of model mice. In the experiments of natural aging mice, GAP also showed good effects such as increasing spleen index and thymus index, enhancing phagocytosing ability of peritoneal macrophage and DTH reaction, promoting production of serum hemolysins immunized with SRBC. Conclusion: GAP can delay aging process of D-galactose-induced subacute aging mice and natural aging mice in some degree, the mechanism maybe related to increasing immune function and antioxidative ability.

O0GhadBV.title: Bone marrow stem cells transplantation improve locomotive function of dystrophin/utrophin gene double knock-out mice]
O0GhadBV.abstract: Study the improvement of locomotive faculty of dystrophin/utropin gene double knock-out mice (dko mice) by transplanting bone marrow stem cells.The bone marrow stem cells of C57BL/6 mice (4- to 5-weeks age) were cultured in vitro for three days, before transplanted intravenously (1.0 x 10(7) for each) into 11 dko mice (7- to 8-weeks age). The dko mice were irridiated with 7Gy gamma-ray before transplantation. 8-9 weeks after transplantation, the locomotroy function, electromyography items and expression of dystrophin in transplanted mice and controls were observed.8-9 weeks after transplantation, the dropping times of hauling wire were 3.09 +/- 2.47, compared with that of the control dko mice(16.78 +/- 3.60), there are distinct differences. About electromyography items, the duration of active potential and amplitude of maxim contractions were (4.99 +/- 1.62) ms and(2872 +/- 1474.33) microV, compare with those of control dko mice(3.69 +/- 0.40) ms and(1210.0 +/- 551.0) microV, respectively, about 7% fibers of the muscle tissue of transplanted dko mice expressed dystrophin protein.8-9 weeks after transplanted with homology bone marrow stem cells, the locomotive function and electromyography items of transplanted dko mice were obviously improved, and about 7% muscle tissue fibers of the mice expressing dystrophin protein were observed. It suggested that there is an ideal prospect for DMD therapy with bone marrow stem cells transplantation.

AEZo7t53.title: Study on the water-insoluble steroidal saponins from Dioscorea zingiberensis and cell growth inhibitive effects of steroidal saponins against human hepatocellular carcinoma hepG2 cells
AEZo7t53.abstract: OBJECTIVE To study chemical constituents of the water-insoluble extract from Dioscorea zingiberensis C. H. Wright and cell growth inhibitive effects of chemical constituents against HepG2 cells. METHODS The chemical constituents of waterinsoluble extracts were isolated and purified by silica gel and RP-C18 column chromatography. Their structures were identified by spectral analysis. Anti-proliferative effects of saponins against HepG2 cells were evaluated by MTT assay in vitro. RESULTS Five compounds were isolated and identified as diosgenin ( Ⅰ) ,trillin ( Ⅱ) ,diosgenin diglucoside ( Ⅲ) ,deltonin ( Ⅳ) ,zingiberensis saponin I ( Ⅴ) ,respectively. These five compounds showed remarkable anti-proliferative effects against HepG2 cells and the compound Ⅴ showed the highest potency against HepG2 cells. CONCLUSION Zingiberensis saponin I ( Ⅴ) has significant anti-cancer activity which may be developed as promising anti-cancer drug.

xgg7CvKy.title: Aberrant methylation of NPTX2 in pancreatic carcinoma cell lines
xgg7CvKy.abstract: Objective To investigate the molecular mechanism of down-regulated expression of NPTX2 gene in pancreatic carcinoma.Methods Methylation of NPTX2 gene in 2 samples of normal pancreatic tissues and 6 samples of pancreatic carcinoma cell lines(AsPC1,BxPC3,CFPAC,PaTu8988,PANC1 and SW1990) was detected by the methylation-specific PCR(MSP) method,and then the methylation status was confirmed by sequencing.The expression level and methylation status of NPTX2 were detected with and without 5-aza-2-deoxycytidine(5Aza-dC) treatment,a kind of DNA methyltransferase(DNMT)inhibitor in ASPC1 and PANC1 pancreatic cell lines,by using qRT-PCR and quantitative methylation real time PCR with SYBR Green.Results The methylation of NPTX2 gene was undetected in 2 samples of normal pancreatic tissues,while detected in all the 6 samples of pancreatic carcinoma cell lines in varied degrees,which was confirmed by the results of sequencing.The result of quantitative methylation real time PCR indicated that,before the treatment of 5Aza-dC,the methylation indexes(MI) of AsPC1 and PANC1 pancreatic carcinoma cell lines were 0.964 and 0.531,respectively,and the relative quantities of mRNA expression(RQ) of the two cell lines were 5.251 and 0,respectively.After the treatment of 5Aza-dC,the MI was 0.472 and 0.226,and the RQ was 5.965 and 1.076.The mRNA expression levels of NPTX2 gene increased after 5Aza-dC treatment in both AsPC1 and PANC1 pancreatic carcinoma cell lines.Conclusions The methylation of NPTX2 gene may be the major mechanism of down-regulated expression of NPTX2 gene in pancreatic carcinoma.

2Ktliw5c.title: Role of calcium in protein folding and function of Tva, the receptor of subgroup A avian sarcoma and leukosis virus.
2Ktliw5c.abstract: Tva is the cellular receptor for subgroup A avian sarcoma and leukosis virus (ASLV-A). The viral receptor function of Tva is determined by a 40-residue cysteine-rich motif called the LDL-A module. In this study, we expressed and purified the wild-type (wt) Tva LDL-A module as well as several mutants and examined their in vitro folding properties. We found that, as for other LDL-A modules, correct folding and structure of the Tva LDL-A module is Ca2+ dependent. When calcium was present during in vitro protein folding, the wt module was eluted as a single peak by reverse-phase high-pressure liquid chromatography. Furthermore, two-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy gave well-dispersed spectra in the presence of calcium. In contrast, the same protein folded in vitro in the absence of calcium was eluted as multiple broad peaks and gave a poorly dispersed NMR spectrum in the presence of calcium. The calcium affinity (Kd) of the Tva LDL-A module, determined by isothermal titration calorimetry, is approximately 40 microM. Characterization of several Tva mutants provided further evidence that calcium is important in protein folding and function of Tva. Mutations of the Ca2+-binding residues (D46A and E47A) completely abrogated the Ca2+-binding ability of Tva, and the proteins were not correctly folded. Interestingly, mutations of two non-calcium-binding residues (W48A and L34A) also exerted adverse effect on Ca2+-dependent folding, albeit to a much less extent. Our results provide new insights regarding the structure and function of Tva in ASLV-A entry.

NJmIWW5j.title: Metabolic syndrome, C-reactive protein and microalbuminuria in a rural Chinese population: a cross-sectional study.
NJmIWW5j.abstract: Microalbuminuria is an early marker of chronic kidney disease (CKD). Previous studies have shown that either metabolic syndrome (MetS) or chronic inflammation is related to renal impairment. The aim of this study was to investigate the association between MetS, C-reactive protein (CRP) and microalbuminuria in a rural Chinese population.This was a cross-sectional study using data from the Handan Eye Study. MetS was defined according to the Chinese Diabetes Society (CDS) criteria. CRP levels ≥ 3 mg/L were classified as high CRP. Microalbuminuria was defined as a urinary albumin/creatinine ratio (ACR) of 30-300 mg/g.We included 4191 subjects aged ≥ 30 years in this analysis. The prevalence of MetS and microalbuminuria in the group was 25.7% and 15.6%, respectively. The odds ratio (OR) of microalbuminuria in subjects with MetS was 1.25 (95% confidence interval (CI): 1.03 - 1.51) compared with those without microalbuminuria. In multivariate logistic regression analysis, high blood pressure (OR 1.36, 95% CI: 1.10 - 1.67) and high fasting blood glucose (OR 1.44, 95% CI: 1.17 - 1.76) were independently associated with microalbuminuria. Subjects with high CRP and MetS had a 1.46-fold greater risk of having microalbuminuria compared with those with low CRP without MetS (95% CI: 1.06 - 2.01).In this rural Chinese population aged ≥30 years, MetS and microalbuminuria were independently related and the combination of high CRP and MetS was associated with an increased risk of microalbuminuria.

j4snXaLd.title: Research and Application of Lucene in the Academic Information Service Platform Construction
j4snXaLd.abstract: Specific to the growth of academic information service requirement in today's network environment,a briefly introduction of the open source software of full-text engine named Lucene is described.Based on this software designs and implements the index module and retrieval module in academic information service platform and do the comparative analysis between Lucene and the common relational database on full-text retrieval performance.The results show that Lucene can effectively improve the retrieval ability of academic information service platform.

aKbFbbHQ.title: Comparison of Fresh Tomato Cultivars in Spring Solar Greenhouse in Zhengzhou
aKbFbbHQ.abstract: In order to improve the yield and quality of fresh tomato cultivars in spring greenhouse and screen out the suitable cultivars for Zhengzhou,we carried out the comparative test of four special-purpose tomato cultivars in greenhouse on their adaptability,yield and economic value by taking Jinpeng No.1 as control.The results showed that the cultivar Fenbao possessed high resistance to virus disease,low rates of malformed and cracking fruits,and it was early maturing with growth period of 181 days.The cultivar Fenbao had highest early yield,and its early and total yields increased by 45% and 27.5% respectively compared with those of the control.The cultivar Tiejiangjun was mid-early maturing with growth period of 186 days.Tiejiangjun possessed the lowest fruit cracking rate,and its early yield and total yield increased by 6.6% and 21.2% compared with those of the control.The two cultivars Fenbao and Tiejiangjun possessed better comprehensive performance,and they were suitable to be planted in Zhengzhou in large scale.The cultivars Xianke No.1 and Fenzuan possessed good comprehensive performance,but farmers should pay attention to the prevention and control of virus disease,and strengthen the temperature management in the flower-bud differentiation period of Fenzuan to prevent the emerge of abnormal flowers.Farmers could plant suitable cultivars according to their needs.

0360fbvN.title: The diosgenin prodrug nanoparticles with pH-responsive as a drug delivery system uniquely prevents thrombosis without increased bleeding risk
0360fbvN.abstract: Thrombosis is the leading cause of death in patients with cardiovascular disease in the world. Current antithrombotic agent aspirin has serious side effects such as higher bleeding risk and serious gastrointestinal ulcers. Diosgenin reported in clinical research could prevent thrombosis without side effects. However, poor bioavailability and low knowledge on its molecular targets limit its clinical application. A novel prodrug with antithrombotic effect was prepared based on conjugating diosgenin derivatives to PEG with Schiff-base bond. The prodrug with long blood circulation time and satisfying safety could self-assemble into micelles in water. The prodrug micelles with pH-responsibility could targetedly release diosgenin in position of thrombus in vivo. The results indicate that the prodrug micelles without bleeding risk and histological damages prevent thrombosis by inhibiting platelet activation and apoptosis. Our studies demonstrate that the prodrug micelles could obviously enhance the efficacy in the prevention of arterial thrombus and venous thrombus than aspirin.

wLN3lC6h.title: A promising clean process for production of diosgenin from Dioscorea zingiberensis C. H. Wright
wLN3lC6h.abstract: This study proposes a new approach for diosgenin production from Dioscorea zingiberensis C. H. Wright tubers with respect to resources utilization and clean production. This process consisted of two successive parts, i.e., recovery of starch from raw material, and microbial hydrolysis of the residue to produce diosgenin by Trichoderma reesei . In the first step, about 75.4% of hemicellulose and 98.0% of starch were removed from the tubers. In the second step, about 90.2% of diosgenin was released from saponins by T. reesei at 30 °C, at an aeration of 0.80 vvm and agitation rate of 300 rpm in a 5.0 L bioreactor. Significant reduction of pollutant production was detected by replacing the traditional approach with the proposed new method. About 99.2% of reducing sugar, 99.4% of chemical oxygen demand, 99.2% of total organic carbon, 100% of SO 4 2− , and 100% of acid was reduced in the new processing wastewater. Keywords Diosgenin yield Saponins Trichoderma reesei Microbial hydrolysis Dioscorea zingiberensis Abbreviations DZW Dioscorea zingiberensis C. H. Wright PDZW pretreated Dioscorea zingiberensis C. H. Wright COD chemical oxygen demand p NPG p -nitrophenyl- β - d- glucoside TOC total organic carbon MS mass spectrometry 1 Introduction Diosgenin is an important steroidal precursor in pharmaceutical industry [1,2] . It usually occurs in plants of Dioscorea , Costus and Trigonella in the form of saponins, which attach glucose or rhamnose to aglycone by C–O glucosidic bonds [3,4] . Production of diosgenin from plant tubers mainly depends on the hydrolysis of these chemical bonds. In the traditional method, sulfuric acid is usually used for this purpose. However, this process resulted in serious environmental problems for a great volume of wastewater with high concentration of chemical oxygen demand (COD), SO 4 2− and acid was produced [5,6] . Several studies have reported to have solved this problem, most of which were focused on excluding about 90% of fiber and starch in plant tubers by physical or biological methods before acid hydrolysis [7] . This pretreatment procedure could decrease at least 50% of COD in wastewater, but the huge amount of acid wastewater is still a critical problem in the diosgenin industry. It is well known that biotransformation methods have remarkable predominance due to their high selectivity and mild reaction conditions [8,9] . Life cycle assessment shows that compared with inorganic catalysis, the biological transformation is environmentally more favorable and can save energy [10] . Production of diosgenin by biological transformation is an attractive clean alternative. To release diosgenin from saponins, multi-enzymes (cellulase, β-glucosidase and pectinase) [11] or raw enzymes produced by mutant Aspergillus niger [12] can be used. However, it is not an economical approach since the prices of enzymes are high [13] . The cost of the microbial method is reduced [14,15] , but the major drawback of this approach is the low diosgenin yield [16,17] . Saponins in plant cells are wrapped by the starch, which is a more easily utilized carbon source for microorganisms. Existence of starch in plant tubers will protect saponins from being hydrolyzed by the microorganisms. In previous research, we intended to solve this problem by enzymatic saccharifying of the raw material to recover the starch before microbial hydrolysis [18] . However, few studies have been made to scale up the new process and evaluate the environmental impacts and material consumption of the new process. The purpose of this study was to optimize the fermentation parameter to scale up the new process in a 5.0 L bioreactor, and compare the material consumption and pollution production of the traditional and new processes to evaluate the environmental and economic effect of our proposed method. 2 Methods 2.1 Raw material The dried Dioscorea zingiberensis C. H. Wright (DZW) tubers used for diosgenin production were provided by Tianhe Pharmaceutical Company, Yunxi, Hubei, China. α-Amylase (2000 IU/g) and saccharifying enzyme (10000 IU/g) were obtained from Beijing Donghua Biotechnology Company, China. 2.2 Microorganism The fungal strain Trichoderma reesei with the collection number 30597 was conserved in Agricultural Culture Collection of China and acclimated in sterilized substrate of 50% multi-saponins. The strain was stored at 4 °C on potato dextrose agar slant and subcultured routinely at an interval of 2 weeks. To prepare the inocula, spores in a 7-day-old agar slant were suspended in 5 mL of 0.01% Tween 80 solution and transferred into 100 mL of subculture medium composed of (g/L): 30 sucrose, 3 NaNO 3 , 1 K 2 HPO 4 , 0.5 MgSO 4 , 0.01 FeSO 4 and 0.1 Tween 80. Fungal cells were subgenerated on a shaking incubator at 150 rpm at 30 °C for 3 days. 2.3 New process The flow chart of the proposed new process was shown in Fig. 1 a . The dried raw material was cleaned, cut and ground. The powder (500 g) was uniformly mixed with 3 L tap water in a reaction vessel and boiled for 1 h, then adjusted to pH 6.5 after cooling, incubated at 70 °C for 1 h with 10 g of dry amylase. The enzymatic hydrolysate solution was adjusted to pH 4.0 at room temperature, then saccharified with 15 g of saccharifying enzyme at 60 °C for 8 h, followed by centrifugation at 4000 rpm for 10 min. The solid residue was washed with water, centrifuged and dried at 60 °C, and ground again to pass through a 100-mesh screen. About 180 g pretreated DZW (PDZW) was obtained. Microbial hydrolysis tests were then conducted in a 5 L stirred bioreactor containing 80 g peptone, 8.7 g K 2 HPO 4 , 293 g PDZW and 3 L H 2 O for 7 days. Base on the previous optimization of fermentation medium and conditions in flask shake level, Tween 80, temperature, aeration and agitation rates were further optimized when fermentation was scaled up. Biomass, diosgenin yield, and β-glucosidase during microbial hydrolysis were determined to evaluate the hydrolysis efficiency. 2.4 Traditional process Dried DZW (500 g) was mixed with 1 L H 2 O in a 2 L beaker, fermented at 30 °C with no additional strain for 7 days. About 1 L H 2 O was added to the beaker during the fermentation to keep DZW wet. Then 1.5 L of 1 M H 2 SO 4 was added and the reaction was conducted at 121 °C for 3 h in a hydrolysis vessel ( Fig. 1 b). The hydrolyte was filtered and washed with water until it became neutral. The filtrate residue was dried at 60 °C and diosgenin contained in it was determined. 2.5 Analysis 2.5.1 Biomass Since the existence of PDZW, the biomass of T. reesei during the microbial hydrolysis could not be estimated directly. Intracellular protein concentration was detected with a UV/VIS spectrophotometer using the method described by Zhang et al. [19] . The fermentation sample was centrifuged, and the cells were collected and washed with distilled water twice, then lysed with 20 mL of 0.2 M NaOH at 100 °C for 20 min. The protein in lysate was determined with the standard Lowry method at 595 nm. 2.5.2 β-Glucosidase The sample broth was centrifuged at 4 °C and 10,000 rpm for 15 min. The suspension was obtained for activity analysis. One milliliter of 5 mM p NPG (pH 4.8 acetate buffer) was maintained at 50 °C for 10 min, then 1 mL of appropriately diluted enzyme was added. The enzyme reaction was stopped by adding 1 mL of 1 M Na 2 CO 3 after 10 min. The mixture was then measured at 420 nm. One unit of β-glucosidase activity was defined as the amount of enzyme that released 1 μmol p -nitrophenol under the above conditions in 1 min. 2.5.3 Diosgenin The whole fermentation medium in the bioreactor was centrifuged, dried at 60 °C, extracted with chloroform ultrasonic treating for 30 min, and filtrated. Diosgenin in filtrate was detected with high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) [9] . Diosgenin yield (%) is accounted for with the equation: Y = C m − C 0 C a − C 0 × 100 % Where Y is diosgenin yield (%); C m and C a are diosgenin content in substrate after microbial and acid treatment; C 0 is the diosgenin content in substrate. 2.5.4 Water quality analysis COD, total organic carbon (TOC), SO 4 2− , H + , reducing sugar, and organic compounds in new and traditional processing wastewater were determined with the method described by Cheng et al. [9] in the same laboratory to investigate the environmental impact of the new approach. 3 Results and discussion 3.1 New process 3.1.1 Enzymatic saccharification With enzymatic saccharification, about 75.4% hemicellulose and 98.0% starch were excluded from tubers, resulting in 29.1% hemicellulose, 2.11% starch and 9.25% diosgenin in PDZW. About 180 g of PDZW was obtained when 500 g DZW was treated. It can be calculated that during the saccharification process, 9.90% of diosgenin increased as the release of saponins from wrap of starch. About 120 g sugar was recovered from 500 g DZW and can be used as carbon sources in the fermentation industry for the production of ethanol, lactic acid, citric acid, vitamin B 2 , and so on [7,11]. In industry, it is common that some of wastes could be recovered by using them as raw materials in other industrial sectors [20] . 3.1.2 Microbial hydrolysis In microbial hydrolysis procedure, the optimal media components and condition parameters were achieved through response surface methodology in flask shake level (data were not shown). The analysis of variance indicated that factors affected in microbial hydrolysis followed the order: [Tween 80] > [peptone] > [K 2 HPO 4 ], temperature > incubation period > [substrate] > pH. Scale-up was conducted in a 5.0 L stirred tank bioreactor to produce diosgenin in a larger scale. The effect of the two most significant factors, concentration of Tween 80 and temperature, were further investigated in detail [21] . Oxygen plays an important role in aerobic bioprocessing. It is controlled by aeration and agitation rates when fermentation is carried out in a stirred tank bioreactor. Thus, the aeration and agitation rates were also optimized in this study. Different concentrations of surfactant Tween 80, at 0.25%, 0.73% and 1.25%, were added to the medium. β-Glucosidase played a key role in biotransformation of saponins; in some ranges, the higher the β-glucosidase was, the more diosgenin was accumulated. It can be seen from Table 1 that Tween 80, at the concentration of 0.25% and 0.73%, stimulated the production of β-glucosidase and increased diosgenin yield without obvious impact on biomass. A maximum enzyme production and diosgenin yield were gained when 0.73% Tween 80 was added. Supplement of 1.25% Tween 80 inhibited growth of the microorganism, and resulted in a lower production of enzyme and reduced yield of diosgenin. As saponins in PDZW are poorly soluble, it may decrease the microbial hydrolysis efficiency. The purpose of this work is bioconversion of saponins to diosgenin, which including production of β-glucosidase and hydrolysis of saponins. In this experiment, Tween 80 does not have a significant effect on fungal growth, but could increase β-glucosidase production and accelerate the bioconversion of saponins. The positive influence of surfactant in solid substrate medium when incubated with different microorganisms has been already reported, though the mechanism by which they enhance hydrolysis efficiency is so far not well demonstrated [22–24] . The general accepted point is that Tween 80 could improve the growth rate of microorganisms, alter the membrane surface property to stimulate the enzyme production, and increase solubility of substrate during the fungal fermentation [25,26] . The influence of temperature on fungal growth, β-glucosidase production and diosgenin accumulation were estimated at 20, 30, and 40 °C. The result is shown in Table 2 . During the test, other conditions were fixed at optimal levels. The maximum diosgenin yield of 88.8 ± 2.68% was achieved at 30 °C after 6.5 days fermentation, with a biomass of 3.11 ± 0.12 g/L and β-glucosidase activity of 6.53 ± 0.51 IU/mL. At 20 °C, the biomass decreased to 1.89 ± 0.11 g/L, resulting in lower enzyme activity of 3.72 ± 0.43 IU/mL and diosgenin yield of 30.4 ± 3.87%. At 40 °C, the biomass decreased to 1.02 ± 0.07 IU/mL, with β-glucosidase activity and diosgenin yield decreasing to 1.53 ± 0.14 IU/mL and 73.0 ± 1.74%. Temperature is an important factor for microorganism growth and metabolism; it affects nutrient intake, enzyme activity, substrate solubility and the interfacial tension between the enzyme and the substrate during the biotransformation process. The higher diosgenin yield observed at 30 °C may be explained by the increased β-glucosidase activity, in agreement with our earlier finding which showed that β-glucosidase can release diosgenin from binding form of saponins compounds in DZW tuber [11] . Sheldon et al. also reported that optimum enzyme production for T. reesei was in the temperature range of 25–30 °C [27] . The influence of the agitation rate on fungal growth, β-glucosidase activity and diosgenin accumulation was evaluated ( Table 3 ). Maximum biomass and β-glucosidase activity were observed when the agitation speed was set at 300 rpm. Increasing of the agitation rate resulted in a decrease in the fungal growth and enzyme production but an increase in diosgenin yield. The yield reached its highest at an agitation of 300 rpm and then decreased. The result was similar to the research done by Bhattacharyya et al. [28] on fermentation of Geotrichum candidum for the production of carbonyl reductase. Increasing agitation speed could increase dissolved oxygen in liquid, leading to fungal growth and enzyme production, while strenuous agitating would generate stress which diminishes mycelia growth and induces lower enzyme activity. The reactant surface area also increased with accelerating agitation, which can explain the higher diosgenin yield with lower enzyme activity at 300 rpm. The influence of aeration rate on β-glucosidase activity and diosgenin yield is shown in Table 4 . When the fungus was grown at 0.6 vvm, highest biomass and β-glucosidase activity were achieved, higher aeration speed (0.8 vvm) did not support more enzyme produced but did result in a higher diosgenin yield as the reactant surface area between substrate and enzyme increased. A further increase in aeration rate led to a decrease of enzyme activity and diosgenin yield. Oxygen depletion usually occurred when the bioreactor ran at higher aeration speed (1.0 vvm and 1.2 vvm) because of the incomplete mixing of substance in the bioreactor. Foam formation was another problem caused by high aeration rate, which led to movement of fungal cell and enzyme. Therefore 300 rpm agitation rate and 0.8 vvm aeration speed were optimum for diosgenin scaled-up bioproduction. A yield of 90.2 ± 3.12% was obtained under these conditions. 3.2 Comparison of traditional method and new processes 3.2.1 The quality of diosgenin The products from the two processes were analyzed with nuclear magnetic resonance, HPLC, HPLC–Mass Spectrometry (MS), and melting point determination. The melting point and purity of diosgenin obtained from the new process was 208.59 °C and 98.4%, which was similar to that achieved from the traditional process and satisfied the Quality Standard of Diosgenin in China (melting point: ≥195 °C) [29] . 3.2.2 Time As shown in Table 5 , the new process took about 188 h for diosgenin preparation in a 5.0 L bioreactor, about 17 h longer than the traditional method which took about 171 h. 3.2.3 Environmental compatibility Evaluation of environmental compatibility of the new process was performed by comparison of qualities of wastewater produced from the traditional and new processes. Compared with the traditional method, the new approach could extract 89.5% of diosgenin, with 99.2% of reducing sugar, 99.4% of COD, 99.2% of TOC, 100% of SO 4 2− and 100% of acid removed from wastewater. Gas chromatography/MS performance was introduced to analyze the organic compounds in wastewater produced from the two processes. The compounds were identified according to the NIST 0.5 database and are presented in Table 6 . The data analysis revealed the existence of at least 31 kinds of organic components in traditional processing wastewater, many of which are unfavorable to the environment, and some are difficult to biodegrade [5] . Only two organic compounds, 1,2-benzenedicarboxylic acid, butyl 2-methylpropyl ester and 5-androsten-17β-ol-3-one, were detected in wastewater produced from the new process. As shown in Fig. 1 , most of the compounds in traditional processing wastewater were produced in acid hydrolysis. In this process, besides saponins, other components (starch, fiber, lipid and colloid) in DZW were degraded into small molecular compounds, leading to high concentrations of reducing sugar, COD, and TOC in wastewater. In the new approach, microbial hydrolysis was a mild and specific method with much fewer by-products induced, exhibiting an excellent performance in reducing organic pollutants in processing wastewater. It was implied that the microbial approach is a clean method for diosgenin production. 3.2.4 Financial analysis The capital and operation costs of the traditional and new processes are shown in Table 7 . The capital cost of the new process was about 15,300 dollars including the equipment purchase of reaction vessel, centrifuge and bioreactor, while the investment in the traditional process was about 11,000 dollars for the purchase of the hydrolysis vesse1 and centrifuge. Although the new process resulted in a higher capital cost, the investment in wastewater treatment equipment was high when the traditional process was applied [5] . When 1 t of DZW was used for producing diosgenin, the use of acid was 3000 L of 1 M H 2 SO 4 in the conventional system, which cost 29 dollars. The running cost of enzyme (amylase and saccharifying enzyme) and fermentation nutrient (peptone, K 2 HPO 4 and Tween 80) was about 178 dollars in the new process. The amount of water needed in the conventional process was 2000 L per 1 t DZW and most of consumption took place in washing the acid hydrolysate. The use of water in the new process was mainly due to the enzymatic saccharification process and about 10000 L per 1 t treated DZW. The energy consumption (primary electricity) for the traditional method mainly focused on the acid hydrolysis process, which applied high pressure (1.21 Pa) and high temperature (121 °C) for 3 h, while in the new method most energy was consumed in the process of liquification and saccharification. The lesser operating costs of the new process came from reduction of water and acid use, decrease of wastewater discharge and production of sugar, while being at a disadvantage on the use of enzyme and fungal strains and lower diosgenin yield. In total, the financial cost of the new process was about 100 dollars higher than that of the traditional process per 1 t of DZW treated. The higher cost was mainly due to the nutrients required for microorganism growth, such as peptone, K 2 HPO 4 and Tween 80. These nutrients might be replaced by some cheaper organic nitrogen source, phosphate source and surface active agent in industry, thus reducing running costs. The income of the new process was 1340 dollars/kg DZW; this value was 1420 dollars/t DZW when traditional process was employed. The lower income of the new process was due to the lower diosgenin yield of microbial hydrolysis compared with acid hydrolysis. For future research, one should aim at increasing the microbial hydrolysis efficiency using techniques of molecular biology. Although the income of the new process was lower, the net income of 612 dollars was the result when 1 t of DZW was treated by this method. It is thus a promising technology for diosgenin production from an economic viewpoint. 4 Conclusion The production of diosgenin from DZW tubers was accomplished by a successive process including recovery of available resources and microbial hydrolysis. The optimal conditions for microbial hydrolysis in the 5.0 L bioreactor were obtained at 0.73% Tween 80, temperature of 30 °C, agitation rate of 300 rpm and aeration speed of 0.8 vvm. Compared to the traditional method, the proposed new process could extract 89.5% of diosgenin and decrease 99.2% of reducing sugar, 99.4% of COD, 99.2% of TOC, 100% of SO 4 2− and 100% of acid in processing wastewater, indicating that it was a clean and effective technology in diosgenin production. Future study can concentrate on increasing the microbial hydrolysis efficiency using molecular biology technology and reducing the nutrient cost during the microbial hydrolysis. r5CTi0ku.title: The microwave noise characteristics of InAlN/GaN HEMTs
r5CTi0ku.abstract: The microwave noise characteristics of InAlN/GaN heterojunction HEMTs are analysed by using an equivalent circuit model in this paper. It shows that the minimum noise figure of InAlN/GaN HEMTs can be comparable with that of AlGaN/GaN HEMTs at X-band and higher frequency band. However, at the lower microwave frequency band, the minimum noise figure of InAlN/GaN HEMTs is a little worse, the reason of which is because of its high gate-leakage current. At last, three proposals are provided to improve the noise characteristics of InAlN/GaN HEMTs. © 2010 IEEE.

DDnJuNQ2.title: Expression of matrix metalloproteinases in glomerulosclerosis in rats
DDnJuNQ2.abstract: Objective To assay the expression change of matrix metalloproteinasea-2 (MMP-2) and matrix metalloproteinasea-9 (MMP-9) in focal segmental glomerulosclerosis in rats, and to investigate the relationship between the expression of MMP-2 and MMP-9 and the accumulation of extracellular matrix (ECM) in the kidney in these rats. Methods We divided 12 Wistar rats into test group and control group. The model of focal segmental glomerursclerosis (n=7) was made by intravenous injection of puromycin aminonucleoside (PAN) 9mg/100g body weight. Rats in control group (n=5) were injected with 3ml 0.9% sodium chloride. Proteinuria and serum creatinine, lipids and protein were examined. Twenty weeks after the injection rats were sacrificed and their kidneys were taken for examination. Renal MMP-2, MMP-9 and fibronectin (FN) were examined by Immunohistochemistry. Positive immunohistochemical signals were quantitatively analysed using the Image-pro software. Results Rats in the test group had prominent protienuria and the increase of serum lipids. Pathologically, the kidney showed focal segmental sclerosis or sclerosis of the whole glomerulus in a part of glomeruli. ECM was segmentally accumulated in the kidney. MMP-9 normally expresses in glomerular endothelial and epithelial cells at a low level, but the expression decreased significantly in glomeruli of the rats in test group (P<0.05). There was no significant relationship between the MMP-9 expression and proteinuia. MMP-2 normally expresses in small renal arteries and the interstitium around renal tubules at a low level, but the expression decreased insignificantly in kidney of the rats in test group (P>0.05). FN normally expresses in glomeruli mesangial areas, glomerular basement membrane and renal interstitium, and the expression increased significantly in kidney of the rats in test group (P<0.05). FN expression negatively correlated with MMP-9 expression, but had no relationship with MMP-2 expression and proteinuria. Conclusion In the pathogenesis of focal segmental glomerulosclerosis, MMP-9 expression is down-regulated, resulting in the decrease of FN catabolism and the ECM accumulation.

0BoIeMid.title: Increasing Antiradical Activity of Polyphenols from Lotus Seed Epicarp by Probiotic Bacteria Bioconversion.
0BoIeMid.abstract: Probiotic bacteria is able to metabolize polyphenols and produce functional compounds. In this study, we investigated the ability of probiotic bacteria including , bifidobacteria and  strains to increase the antioxidant capacity of polyphenols from lotus seed epicarp (PLSE) at full ripening stage. The results showed that the six selected strains of probiotic bacteria grew well in De Man, Rogosa and Sharpe (MRS) broth with PLSE, and their resistant extent to PLSE varied from strain to strain. The metabolized PLSE was found to have good antioxidant properties on 3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulfonic acid (ABTS⁺) and 1,1-diphenyl-2-picryl-hydrazyl (DPPH) radicals in vitro. Five polyphenol compounds-chlorogenic acid, caffeic acid, catechin, epicatechin and hyperoside-were suggested as the major bioactive metabolism for the antiradical activity of PLSE metabolized by  DSM20016,  M74 and  ATCC 15701. Moreover,  DSM20016 and  M74 were found to have a high PLSE bioconversion rate. Our results suggested that both  DSM20016 and  M74 might have excellent potential for the bioconversion of PLSE to increase its antiradical activity.

jevflxHA.title: Clinical Observation of Pulmonary Function in Uremic Patients on Hemodilysis
jevflxHA.abstract: Objective To analyse the pulmonary function and related factors in uremic patients on hemodialysis.Methods To determine the pulmonary function of forty-nine patients with uremia(19 patients who were not on hemodialysis,30 patients who were on hemodialysis) and 30 healthy persons.Correlative analysis was performed between parameter such as pulmonary function index and hemoglobin,plasma total albumin,albumin,Bun,Cr in hemodialysis patients;Analyze the relation between pulmonary function and chest X-ray.Results There was significant difference existed between uremic,hemodialysis patients and healthy person(P<0.01,respectively).The index of forced vital capacity expressed as percentages of predicted normal values(FVC%),forced expiratory volume in one second expressed as percentages of predicted normal values(FEV_(1)%),forced expiratory flow rate in one second(FEV_(1)/ FVC%),forced expiratory flow between 25% and 75% of vital capacity expressed(FEF25%~75%),pulmonary diffusion capacity for carbon monoxide expressed as percentages of predicted normal values(DLCO%) were much lower in uremia,hemodialysis patients.There were obvious increase of ventilation and dispersion function after uremic patients on hemodialysis(P<0.05).There was a strong correlation between pulmonary dispersion function and hemoglobin(P<0.05).Conclusion There was obvious lowering of pulmonary function in uremia,anemia was one of the causes to influence the dispersion function.It is necessary to make hemodialysis and cure anemia in order to improve pulmonary function of uremic patients.

LT2Uaih9.title: Effects of Qihuo tonic on hepatic cell aging and ultrastructure in swimming-exhausted rats
LT2Uaih9.abstract: OBJECTIVE To investigate the effects of Qihuo tonic(QHT) on hepatic cell aging and ultrastructure in swimming-exhausted rats.Sixty male SD rats were randomly divided into 4 groups: the swimming-exhausted group,the low dose QHT group,the moderate dose QHT group and the high dose QHT group.After 3 weeks,changes in serum nitrogen monoxidum(NO),alanine aminotransferase(ALT) and aspartate amino transferase(AST) of all the groups were determined.Then,HA2 phosphorylation staining was used to observe hepatic cell aging,and the ultastructural changes in hepatic cells were compared between the groups.Compared with those of the swimming-exhausted group,the levels of NO,ALT and AST in the high,moderate and moderate dose QHT groups decreased significantly(P<0.05),the levels of NO,ALT and AST of the high and low dose groups decreased more significantly,when compared with those of the low dose group(P<0.05).The number of H2A staining positive hepatic cells of the 3 QHT groups was significant lower than that of the control group(P<0.05).The extent of damage to the ultrastructure of hepatic cells in the 3 QHT groups was obviously lighter than that of the control group,and positive correlation could be noted between damage extent and QHT concentration.QHT could obviously alleviate hepatic damage induced by exhausted fatigue in rats,the mechanism of which might be related with the decreased process of hepatic cell aging.

ks4APrq3.title: Research on data acquisition system based on FlexRay
ks4APrq3.abstract: Data acquisition system on industrial control field plays an important role in the whole industrial production procedure. This paper mainly researches FlexRay, a high speed fieldbus technology, and discusses the design procedure of data acquisition system based on FlexRay, including system basic structure, general design, hardware design and software design. The experiment result shows that data acquisition system based on FlexRay is valid and useful on industrial field. ©2009 IEEE.

yZWeDuTK.title: Anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects of saponins from D. zingiberensis C. H. Wright and diosgenin derivative on mice]
yZWeDuTK.abstract: To determine the potential anti-inflammatory and analgesic activities of saponins from D. zingiberensis C. H. Wright and diosgenin derivative on xylene-induced acute ear edema in mice.3beta-2-acetoxy-benzoyl-diosgenin ester (ABDE) was synthesized by acylation of aspirin through two-step of reaction. The analgesic activities of ABDE and saponins were investigated through acetic acid-induced writhing response of the mice. The anti-inflammatory effects of saponins and ABDE were observed on the xylene-induced swelling ears of the mice.The structure of ABDE was confirmed by 1H-NMR and ESI-MS. ABDE had significantly higher anti-inflammatory and analgesic activities than the comparison drug. The saponins demonstrated 7.92% and 14.51% anti-inflammatory activities at the dose of 126 mg/kg and 252 mg/kg, respectively, and 15.38% and 26.15% analgesic activities at the dose of 126 mg/kg and 252 mg/kg, respectively.The saponins of D. zingiberensis C. H. Wright possess acute nonspecific anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects. The anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects of ABDE are equivalent to aspirin.
keywords: saponins diosgenin aspirin esterify anti-inflammatory and analgesic activitie

9wa8zJrv.title: Preparation of Fermented Mushroom Using Starter Culture and Quality Analysis
9wa8zJrv.abstract: The preparation of fermented P.cornucopiae,P.pulmonarius and P.ostreatus using a starter culture of Lactobacillus plantarum was studied.Microbial and physicochemical changes during fermentation were determined.In addition,the sensory quality of fermented mushroom was also evaluated.The results showed that mushroom could successfully conduct lactic acid fermentation and fermented mushroom had a mild acidic taste and typical characteristics of sauerkraut.The final pH for mushroom fermentation was 3.4-3.6,which was in the range of sauerkraut and kimchi.Sensory evaluation showed that fermented P.cornucopiae was a favorable product with excellent appearance,flavor,texture and overall acceptance.During the whole fermentation period,nitrite concentrations in fermented P.cornucopiae,P.pulmonarius and P.ostreatus were low,suggesting that the mushroom pickles were safe.

4WI4TuQl.title: Phenotypic Characterization and Genetic Dissection of Growth Period Traits in Soybean (Glycine max) Using Association Mapping.
4WI4TuQl.abstract: The growth period traits are important traits that affect soybean yield. The insights into the genetic basis of growth period traits can provide theoretical basis for cultivated area division, rational distribution, and molecular breeding for soybean varieties. In this study, genome-wide association analysis (GWAS) was exploited to detect the quantitative trait loci (QTL) for number of days to flowering (ETF), number of days from flowering to maturity (FTM), and number of days to maturity (ETM) using 4032 single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) markers with 146 cultivars mainly from Northeast China. Results showed that abundant phenotypic variation was presented in the population, and variation explained by genotype, environment, and genotype by environment interaction were all significant for each trait. The whole accessions could be clearly clustered into two subpopulations based on their genetic relatedness, and accessions in the same group were almost from the same province. GWAS based on the unified mixed model identified 19 significant SNPs distributed on 11 soybean chromosomes, 12 of which can be consistently detected in both planting densities, and 5 of which were pleotropic QTL. Of 19 SNPs, 7 SNPs located in or close to the previously reported QTL or genes controlling growth period traits. The QTL identified with high resolution in this study will enrich our genomic understanding of growth period traits and could then be explored as genetic markers to be used in genomic applications in soybean breeding.

1yGBnhux.title: Monitoring parameters calibration of nuclear reactor control and protection system
1yGBnhux.abstract: It's difficult to carry out the on-site calibration of the measuring equipment of nuclear reactor control and protection system,especially to carry out calibration of power measuring protection equipment and period measuring protection equipment,the input signals range from reactor intermediate range to reactor full level,or from 10-11A to 10-4A,the output period signal scaled by 1/T function.Because of the errors introduced during signal measurement,conversion and transmission,the same signal has difference display value in the protection system and the distributed control system(DCS).This paper presents a calibration method of Neutron Flux Measurement Instrumentation(NFMI) based on author's experience calibrating NFMI in the commissioning of research reactors.Through modifying measurement software,we can ensure the signals keep 1.05∶1.1 relation between the alarm system and protection system.The period protection trigger action point calibrated by specific software to ensure the protection system sending accident trigger action once the reactor power period below 10s.Results of calibration meet the accuracy requirements of the protection system triggering,the monitoring parameter values also display more consistent in different systems.

Bsetk96U.title: Ultra-Sensitive Strain Sensor Based on Flexible Poly(vinylidene fluoride) Piezoelectric Film.
Bsetk96U.abstract: A flexible 4 × 4 sensor array with 16 micro-scale capacitive units has been demonstrated based on flexible piezoelectric poly(vinylidene fluoride) (PVDF) film. The piezoelectricity and surface morphology of the PVDF were examined by optical imaging and piezoresponse force microscopy (PFM). The PFM shows phase contrast, indicating clear interface between the PVDF and electrode. The electro-mechanical properties show that the sensor exhibits excellent output response and an ultra-high signal-to-noise ratio. The output voltage and the applied pressure possess linear relationship with a slope of 12 mV/kPa. The hold-and-release output characteristics recover in less than 2.5 μs, demonstrating outstanding electro-mechanical response. Additionally, signal interference between the adjacent arrays has been investigated via theoretical simulation. The results show the interference reduces with decreasing pressure at a rate of 0.028 mV/kPa, highly scalable with electrode size and becoming insignificant for pressure level under 178 kPa.

S2fxkjww.title: Corilagin from longan seed: Identification, quantification, and synergistic cytotoxicity on SKOv3ip and hey cells with ginsenoside Rh2 and 5-fluorouracil.
S2fxkjww.abstract: Corilagin content from different parts of longan (Dimocarpus longan Lour.) was determined by ultra performance liquid chromatography (UPLC) method. Additionally, the potential synergistic effects of corilagin + ginsenoside Rh2 (Rh2), and corilagin + 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) on ovarian cancer cells, and cancer-preventing activities, including inhibition of tyrosinase, properties of antioxidant and nitrite-scavenging, and blocking of nitrosamine synthesis were investigated. The results showed the content of corilagin from different parts of longan varied widely, while corilagin content in longan seed was high with a value of 542.15 ± 10.30 μg/g. Then the corilagin from longan seed was chosen for further study, since longan seed was easily obtained from by-product of longan fruit processing with low cost. Furthermore, the combinations of corilagin + Rh2, and corilagin + 5-FU showed an increased synergistic cytotoxicity on SKOv3ip and Hey cells. Moreover, corilagin inhibited exhibited effects of inhibiting tyrosinase, antioxidation, scavenging nitrite and blocking nitrosamine synthesis.

cS3nKWNE.title: Genetic basis of transcriptome diversity in Drosophila melanogaster.
cS3nKWNE.abstract: Understanding how DNA sequence variation is translated into variation for complex phenotypes has remained elusive but is essential for predicting adaptive evolution, for selecting agriculturally important animals and crops, and for personalized medicine. Gene expression may provide a link between variation in DNA sequence and organismal phenotypes, and its abundance can be measured efficiently and accurately. Here we quantified genome-wide variation in gene expression in the sequenced inbred lines of the Drosophila melanogaster Genetic Reference Panel (DGRP), increasing the annotated Drosophila transcriptome by 11%, including thousands of novel transcribed regions (NTRs). We found that 42% of the Drosophila transcriptome is genetically variable in males and females, including the NTRs, and is organized into modules of genetically correlated transcripts. We found that NTRs often were negatively correlated with the expression of protein-coding genes, which we exploited to annotate NTRs functionally. We identified regulatory variants for the mean and variance of gene expression, which have largely independent genetic control. Expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs) for the mean, but not for the variance, of gene expression were concentrated near genes. Notably, the variance eQTLs often interacted epistatically with local variants in these genes to regulate gene expression. This comprehensive characterization of population-scale diversity of transcriptomes and its genetic basis in the DGRP is critically important for a systems understanding of quantitative trait variation.

PzOcFskx.title: First-principles study of static polarizability, first and second hyperpolarizabilities of small-sized ZnO clusters.
PzOcFskx.abstract: The static linear and nonlinear optical properties of (ZnO)N clusters of N= 2-12 are studied using finite field approach within the framework of density functional theory. Most of these clusters feature ring or cage structures in the specific size range, differing much from the wurtzite structure of bulk ZnO. The low-lying isomers with various structures possess remarkably different properties. The effect of ring structure, cluster stability, HOMO-LUMO gap, covalent/ionic bonding, etc., on the dipole moment, polarizability, first and second hyperpolarizabilites is discussed. Both the polarizability and second hyperpolarizability exhibit distinct size dependences, reflecting clearly the structural transition when the cluster grows. Our study reveals that the linear and nonlinear optical properties of ZnO clusters vary a lot in the size range studied, as a result of their structural diversity at small sizes.

o0c7Q2qQ.title: ZNF322, a novel human C 2H 2 Krüppel-like zinc-finger protein, regulates transcriptional activation in MAPK signaling pathways
o0c7Q2qQ.abstract: Cardiac differentiation involves a cascade of coordinated gene expression that regulates cell proliferation and matrix protein formation in a defined temporal-spatial manner. The C 2H 2 zinc finger-containing transcription factors have been implicated as critical regulators of multiple cardiac-expressed genes and are important for human heart development and diseases. Here we have identified and characterized a novel zinc-finger gene named ZNF322 using degenerated primers from a human embryo heart cDNA library. The gene contains four exons and spans 23.2 kb in chromosome 6p22.1 region, and transcribes a 2.7 kb mRNA that encodes a protein with 402 amino acid residues. The predicted protein contains 9 tandem C 2H 2-type zinc-finger motifs. Northern blot analysis shows that ZNF322 is expressed in every human tissue examined at adult stage and during embryonic developmental stages from 80 days to 24 weeks. When overexpressed in COS-7 cells, ZNF322-EGFP fusion protein is detected in the nucleus and cytoplasm. Reporter gene assays show that ZNF322 is a transcriptional activator. Furthermore, overexpression of ZNF322 in COS-7 cells activates the transcriptional activity of SRE and AP-1. Together, these results suggest that ZNF322 is a member of the zinc-finger transcription factor family and may act as a positive regulator in gene transcription mediated by the MAPK signaling pathways. © 2004 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

z8gvQlSd.title: Effects of heat acclimatization on gastrointestinal hormone and cellular immune function of the marine training personnel
z8gvQlSd.abstract: Aim To observe the effects of heat acclimatization on gastrointestinal hormone and cellular immune function of the marine training personnel.Methods There 125 marine training personnel in southeast area in Summer were randomly divided into 2 groups:the heat acclimatization group(60) and the control group(65).The levels of plasma motilin(MTL),vasoactive intestinal peptide(VIP) and somatostatin(SS) of the personnel in the two groups determined by radioimmunoassay two months before and after marine training.The percentage of T,B and NK cell subpopulation were assessed by flow cytomtry.Results There was not significant difference in levels of MTL,VIP and SS before and after marine training(P>0.05).While the level of MTL in the control group was significantly increased and the levels of VIP and SS were significantly decreased after marine training as compared to that before training(P<0.05).Compared with control group,the levels of CD3+,CD3+CD4+,CD4+/CD8+ in the heat acclimatization group increased significantly(P<0.05) and that of CD3+CD8+,CD3-CD56+ decreased significantly(P<0.05).Conclusion Suitable heat acclimatization can enhance function of gastrointestinal system and cellular immune in the marine training personnel.

rGrXiJWO.title: Diagnostic and prognosis assessment values of serum sICAM-1,sVCAM-1 and P-selectin detection for the patients with pancreatic carcinoma
rGrXiJWO.abstract: Objective To investigate the diagnostic and prognosis assessment values of serum soluble intercellular adhesion molecule-1(sICAM-1),soluble vascular cell adhesion molecule-1(sVCAM-1) and P-selectin for the patients with pancreatic carcinoma.Methods The serum levels of sICAM-1,sVCAM-1 and P-selectin of 70 patients with pancreatic carcinoma were measured by ELISA before and after operation(including pancreatic head carcinoma 45cases,body-tail pancreatic carcinoma 25cases;pancreatic carcinoma TNM stageⅠ-Ⅱ34 cases,stage Ⅲ-Ⅳ 36 cases).Patients with benign pancreatic disease were also detected as controls.Results In the patients with pancreatic carcinoma,the serum levels of sICAM-1,sVCAM-1 and P-selectin before operation were higher than those of the benign disease controls(P<0.01).The serum levels of sICAM-1,sVCAM-1 and P-selectin in patients in stage Ⅲ-Ⅳ were significantly higher than those in stage Ⅰ-Ⅱ(P<0.05).The sensitivity of sICAM-1,sVCAM-1 and P-selectin was 81.4%,85.7% and 84.3%,respectively.The sensitivity of combined detection of these three markers was 92.9%.The levels of sICAM-1,sVCAM-1 and P-selectin significantly decreased in 39 cases of patients with pancreatic carcinoma after radical resection compared with those before operation(P<0.05).No significant changes occurred in serum levels of sICAM-1,sVCAM-1 and P-selectin in 31 cases of patients with pancreatic carcinoma after palliative operation(P>0.05).Conclusions Serum levels of sICAM-1,sVCAM-1 and P-selectin are sensitive markers for diagnosis and prognosis assessment for patients with pancreatic carcinoma.The sensitivity of these three markers in the early diagnosis of pancreatic carcinoma would elevate remarkably when combined applying.

McePMhrd.title: Optimization on the culture condition for biosurfactant producing bacteria
McePMhrd.abstract: It is a study about cultivating biosurfactant-producing bacterium W2,which aimed to optimize its best culture condition for bacterium growth and biosurfactant production.The results indicated that the optimized fermentation conditions were as follows(g/L): glucose 40.0,NaNO3 2.67,K2HPO4 1.0,KH2PO4 0.5,KCl 0.1,MgSO4 0.5,CaCl2 0.01,FeSO4·7H2O 0.01,yeast extract 0.1.The most appropriate surfactant medium of W2 was pH=6.5,inoculated quantity 1%,temperature for 30 ℃.Based on the relation of bacterium growth and biosurfactant production,grading culture was applied to biosurfactant production of W2.The experimental results showed that grading culture could keep high biosurfactant yield.

qOZ2kNoT.title: Selection of soybean elite cultivars based on phenotypic and genomic characters related to lodging tolerance
qOZ2kNoT.abstract: Soybean lodging can result in serious yield reduction. Detecting the quantitative trait loci (QTL) associated with lodging tolerance for their further application in marker-assisted selection (MAS) has the potential to enhance soybean breeding efficiency. In this study, a genome-wide association analysis (GWAS) was performed to identify soybean accessions that could potentially be used to produce lodging-tolerant varieties, based on the comprehensive evaluation of lodging scores (LS) obtained for the parental cultivar “Tokachi nagaha” and its 137 derived cultivars. Results showed that genotype, environment and genotype × environment interaction significantly influenced LS. Of the 31 significant SNPs identified, 22 were consistently detected in two or more environments and 27 SNPs were located in or close to agronomically important QTL mapped by linkage analysis. Best linear unbiased predictors (BLUPs) of LS tend to decrease with the elite alleles contained by accessions increasing. Some excellent accessions, with lower BLUPs and Di (stability coefficients) values and more elite alleles, were selected. This study contributed to understand the genetic mechanism of lodging, providing genetic and phenotypic information for MAS.

uOQyDuIP.title: Natural Circulation Capacity Experiment and Numerical Simulation for Pool-Type Research Reactor
uOQyDuIP.abstract: The natural circulation capacity is the important parameter that characterizes the safety capability of a nuclear reactor.In order to analysis the passive safety of a pool-type research reactor,and determine the extreme levels of heat-carrying capacity under natural circulation condition,according to the special core structure,a method was proposed to carry out natural circulation experiment,and a software was developed to analysis the natural circulation capability.The calculation results of core flow satisfy experimental values well,and the relative deviation is less than 1.6%.Under the condition the pool water temperature is 40 ℃,the natural circulation capacity of the reactor is no less than 710 kW according to the calculation result of the code.It indicates that this pool reactor has good passive safety ability.

30RQwzFM.title: Eriodictyol 7‑O‑β‑D glucopyranoside from Coreopsis tinctoria Nutt. ameliorates lipid disorders via protecting mitochondrial function and suppressing lipogenesis.
30RQwzFM.abstract: Coreopsis tinctoria (snow chrysanthemum) has been reported to exert antihyperlipidemic effects. The present study aimed to identify the active compounds of Coreopsis tinctoria and to investigate the molecular mechanisms underlying its effects on lipid dysregulation by measuring lipid levels, reactive oxygen species, lipid peroxidation and fatty acid synthesis. The present results demonstrated that snow chrysanthemum aqueous extracts significantly reduced serum lipid levels and oxidative stress in vivo. The main compounds that were isolated were identified as flavanomarein (compound 1) and eriodictyol 7‑O‑β‑D glucopyranoside (compound 2). Compounds 1 and 2 demonstrated potent antioxidative properties, including free radical scavenging activity, inhibition of lipid peroxidation, as well as lipid‑lowering effects in human HepG2 hepatocellular carcinoma cells treated with free fatty acids (FFAs). Compound 2 was revealed to suppress the elevation of triglyceride levels and inhibit lipid peroxidation following FFA treatment. In addition, it was demonstrated to significantly reduce intracellular levels of reactive oxygen species and improve the mitochondrial membrane potential and adenosine triphosphate levels, thus protecting mitochondrial function in FFA‑treated HepG2 cells. Furthermore, compound 2 markedly suppressed the protein expression levels of disulfide‑isomerase A3 precursor and fatty acid synthase, thus suppressing FFA‑induced lipogenesis in HepG2 cells. In conclusion, the present study identified compound 2 as one of the main active compounds in Coreopsis tinctoria responsible for its lipid‑lowering effects. Compound 2 was revealed to possess antihyperlipidemic properties, exerted via reducing oxidative stress, protecting mitochondrial function and suppressing lipogenesis.

fdqEicSa.title: Automatic Identification of Shaft Orbits for Steam Turbine Generator Sets
fdqEicSa.abstract: The shaft orbits and dynamic characteristics of the shaft centre orbit contain abundant information for the fault diagnosis of rotating machinery and reflect different faults of rotating machine. Therefore the shaft orbits recognition plays an important role in the fault diagnosis of steam turbine generator set. An automatic identification method of shaft orbit for steam turbine generator sets is proposed in this paper. The median morphological filter combining the open-closing with close-opening is used to eliminate the noise in the original X and Y vibration signals. Then the seven invariant moment feature are extracted from the shaft orbit reconstructed. Input the seven invariant moments to the trained BP neural network, the shaft orbit can be identified automatically. A case is verified this model. It is shown that this model is feasible and high precision for identify the shaft orbit in fault diagnosis.
fdqEicSa.venue: Intelligent Systems, 2009. GCIS '09. WRI Global Congress

LoCforQz.title: A preliminary study on the characteristics of β-Glucosidase from a newly isolated Aspergillus fumigates
LoCforQz.abstract: A strain of Aspergillus fumigates with high activity towards Dioscorea zingiberensis saponins was isolated, and the characteristics of its β-glucosidase were studied preliminarily. As shown in the results, the β-glucosidase from Aspergillus fumigates which effectively produced diosgenin from saponins, exhibited the high level of activity and stablity at high temperature. At 65°C and pH6.0, the β-Glucosidase activity of Aspergillus fumigates was 4.1 U/mg, and it retained 77% of its original activity for 48 hours with 1.5 mol/L ammonium sulfate. The β-Glucosidase of this Aspergillus fumigates hydrolyzed the D-glucose at the C-3position in trillin to yield saponin, and the transformation ratio was 56% within 24 hours. © 2011 Peking University.

r3NGLRIH.title: Ultra-sensitive and plasmon-tunable graphene photodetectors for micro-spectrometry.
r3NGLRIH.abstract: We demonstrate an ultra-sensitive photodetector based on a graphene/monolayer MoS2 vertical heterostructure working at room temperature. Highly confined plasmon waves are efficiently excited through a periodic array of monolayer graphene ribbons in which plasmon resonance has remarkably large oscillator strength, resulting in a sharp optical absorption peak in the normal-incidence transmission spectrum. A significant amount of electron-hole pairs are produced in graphene ribbons by optical absorption, separated by the built-in electric field across the graphene/MoS2 heterojunction. The responsivity reaches up to 1 × 107 A W-1 at room temperature due to very strong resonance in the heterostructure, yielding a highly sensitive graphene-based photodetector. Additionally, the absorption can be tuned over a wide spectral range (6-16 μm) by varying gate biasing. The ultra-sensitive, spectrally tunable photodetector could be potentially used as a promising candidate for mid-infrared micro-spectrometers.

Oo52SHSc.title: Hot Air Drying for the Production of Agaricus bisporus Powder
Oo52SHSc.abstract: In this work,the hot Air drying processing technique of Agaricus bisporus powder was studied.The effect of colorprotection solution were discussed.The study results showed that the optimized processing technique were as follows: hot air drying temperature 50 ℃,slice thickness 2 mm,mushroom loading 40 g/m2and drying time 7 h.The optimum color protection solution contained sodium sulfite(0.1 g/100 mL),sodium D-isoascorbate(0.3 g/100 mL) and citric acid(0.05 g/100 mL).Compared with freeze-dried powder,slight reductions were observed in the color,nutritional value and functional properties of hot air dried powder while no significant difference was present.

QGLP1JVk.title: Correlation between the expression of neuron-specific protein and apoptosis in the process of differentiation from rat bone marrow stromal cells into neuron with BDNF
QGLP1JVk.abstract: AIM: To investigate the correlation between the expression of neuron-specific protein and apoptosis in the process of differentiation from rat bone marrow stromal cells into neuron with brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF). METHODS: The 5th passage MSCs were induced by BDNF and 2-mercaptoethanol (β-ME), respectively. At 1 h, 6 h, 12 h and 24 h, nestin, neuron specific enolase (NSE), microtubulease associated protein (MAP)-2 and glail fibrillary acidic protein (GFAP) were detected by Western blotting. Cell cycle and apoptosis were examined by flow cytometry. RESULTS: Nestin and NSE of neuron-like cells induced by BDNF and β-ME were all positive by Western blotting. At 12 h, nestin and NSE turned to negative and apoptosis was detected in β-ME group, nestin and NSE still positive and apoptosis wasn't detected in BDNF group. Till 24 h, nestin and NSE in BDNF group were negative but apoptosis still not detected. Notably, GFAP (glial astrocyte marker) was detected and MAP-2 wasn't detected in the two induced groups. CONCLUSION: The down-expression of neuron-specific protein correspondingly with apoptosis in the process of differentiation from MSCs into neuron with β-ME shows that apoptosis may be one of the causes of induced cell death. BDNF induction was not the cause of apoptosis. Other factors may include for the cell death in the presence of neuron-specific protein expression induced by BDNF.

sWRYFtIW.title: Analysis of hemoglobin level in hemodialysis patients in 2007 Beijing
sWRYFtIW.abstract: Objective To analyze the hemoglobin level in hemodialysis patients recorded in Beijing Hemodialysis Qulity Control Improvement Center (BJHDQCIC) in 2007,and to correlate the hemoglobin level with gender,age,and primary disease. Methods Based on the cross-sectional data provided by BJHDQCIC in 2007 Beijing,the hemoglobin levels in long-term maintenance hemodialysis (MHD) patients and newly enrolled MHD patients were analyzed. The correlation of hemoglobin level with gender,age and primary disease was evaluated. Results In 2007,the overall rate of hemoglobin level within the recommended range after anti-anemia therapy was less than 50% in long-term and newly enrolled MHD patients. Gender was one of the factors that affected the rate of hemoglobin level within the recommended range in long-term MHD patients,but not in newly enrolled MHD patients. Age did not affect the hemoglobin level in both long-term and newly enrolled MHD patients. The rate of hemoglobin level within the recommended range was higher in patients with urinary system tumors,and was lower in those with hemolytic uremic syndrome. However,more patients are required to confirm this phenomenon. Conclusion In long-term and newly enrolled MHD patients in Beijing,the rate of hemoglobin level within the recommended range after anti-anemia therapy was lower than that reported from foreign countries. Gender was one of factors that affected this rate in MHD patients.

GvMJhZU0.title: An analysis of catheter-related bloodstream infections in old hemodialysis patients with tunneled central venous catheterization
GvMJhZU0.abstract: Objective To study catheter-related bloodstream infections (CRBSI) in old hemodialysis patients with tunneled central venous catheterization. Methods Twenty-six old hemodialysis patients with tunneled central venous catheterization were observed and analyzed. Results The incidence of CRBSI in old hemodialysis patients with tunneled central venous catheterization was 1.36 times/1000 catheterization days. Nine strains bacteria were isolated. The bacteria included Staphylococcus epidermidis(33.3%), Staphylococcus aureus (22.2%), Staphylococcus hominis(11.1%), extended spectrum beta-lactamases type Escherichia coli (11.1%), pseudomonas aeruginosa (11.1%), Klebsiella pneumoniae procalcitonin of patients with CRBSI were remarkablely increased. Catheter indwelling time was an independent risk factor for CRBSI(OR = 11.09, P < 0.05). Low albumin level was associated with CRBSI. The level of procalcitonin of patients with CRBSI was increased obviously. Conclusion Prolonged catheter indwelling time is an independent risk factor of CRBSI in old hemodialysis patients with tunneled central venous catheterization.

2tyrAzmF.title: Cloning and Sequence Analysis of Coat Protein Gene of Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus Isolate from Zhengzhou
2tyrAzmF.abstract: Yellow leaf curl symptoms have been observed on tomato for the first time in many prefectures of Zhengzhou during the past several years.To identify the suspected begomovirus,apair of specific primers TYLCV-CPF/TYLCV-CPR was designed according to known genome sequences of tomato yellow leaf curl virus(TYLCV)to conduct PCR,and then the generated specific segment was collected,cloned and sequenced.The homology comparison and phylogenetic analysis of the coat protein gene were made at last.The result indicated that the complete nucleotide sequence of the coat protein gene was 777bp.The homology of the isolate from Zhengzhou was 95% or more with the other TYLCV isolates at nucleotide and amino acid level.The phylogenetic analysis showed that the Zhengzhou isolate was closely related to Beijing,Yantai,Shanghai,Xinjiang isolates of TYLCV.According to the classification criteria of geminivirus,the Zhengzhou isolate should belong to an isolate of TYLCV.

3de5rMXX.title: Experimental study on strain rate-dependent tensile properties of aluminium L2
3de5rMXX.abstract: Tensile experiments of aluminium L2 under different strain-rates (0.001 s-1, 0.02 s-1, 200 s-1, 500 s-1 and 1300 s-1) were carried out and the complete stress strain curves were obtained. The results show that the yield strength σs, the ultimate strength σb and the failure strain εb vary slightly under low strain-rates (ε <0.02 s-1), σb and σs increase with the strain-rate but εb decreases with the strain-rate under high strain-rates (ε > 200 s -1) and the modulus E is insensitive to strain-rate. The strain-rate sensitivity is as sumed to be consistent with the modified power-low of strain-rate hardening law and its simplified model, the Ramberg-Osgood model is adopted to simulate the stress-strain curves of L2 under different strain-rates. The simulated curves show good agreement with the experiment results of China.

wL49Z8wf.title: ZNF418, a novel human KRAB/C2H2 zinc finger protein, suppresses MAPK signaling pathway.
wL49Z8wf.abstract: Cardiac differentiation involves a cascade of coordinated gene expression that regulates cell proliferation and matrix protein formation in a defined temporal-spatial manner. Zinc finger-containing transcription factors have been implicated as critical regulators of multiple cardiac-expressed genes, and are thought to be important for human heart development and diseases. Here, we have identified and characterized a novel zinc finger gene named ZNF418 from a human embryo heart cDNA library. The gene spans 13.5 kb on chromosome 19q13.43 encompassing six exons, and transcribes a 3.7-kb mRNA that encodes a protein with 676 amino acid residues. The predicted protein contains a KRAB-A box and 17 tandem C2H2 type zinc finger motifs. Northern blot analysis indicates that ZNF418 is expressed in multiple fetal and adult tissues, but is expressed at higher levels in the heart. Reporter gene assays show that ZNF418 is a transcriptional repressor, and the KRAB motif of ZNF418 represents the basal repressive domain. Overexpression of ZNF418 in COS-7 cells inhibits the transcriptional activity of SRE and AP-1 which may be silenced by siRNA. These results suggest that ZNF418 is a member of the zincfinger transcription factor family and may act as a negative regulator in MAPK signaling pathway.
